answers.answer: Im so sorry u have a tough choice I think the biggest question is are u able to take of the baby after it is born and do u want it since u said it wasnt planned. Im sure u know but just a reminder there will be ppl that will judge and get nasty but remember its ur familys life and urs not anyone elses decision
I think you should listen to your doctor before it's too late. It's a tough decision but you have two girls to take care of and your health is not in good shape think about your daughters.

To answer the first question by Abbb, I can't answer that with any amount of certaintly but my daughters are supportive and say they will help out, my boyfriend lives with me but he is usually at work or sleeping.  As for if I want it, I can't really say that since I didn't plan this and because of my health I reallywish this wasn't happening

Accidentally hit post before I was done.......was going to say but I would still love it.Also should clarify that my dr didn't exactly say that I should have an abortion.  She said it would be reasonable if decide to but that there is no 100% right decision.

I'm with your doctor. You are already not in a physical or financial position to take on another person and I worry about what the stress of a pregnancy would do to you as far as the pain of fibromyalgia goes. I'd make the difficult but understandable choice of having an abortion. Good luck.

Hey my aunty was in the same boat as you. She ignored her Dr as our family don't believe in abortions unless there's something wrong with the baby. Babies are blessings from God. A little gift. I believe you was given another chance. If you have support from your family then you should be fine. I would get a second opinion from other Dr. Babies didn't ask to be born its a little sad though.

Have you thought about adoption??  You have very ligit reasons for not being able to care for another child, but it also sounds like maybe an abortion isn't want you favor....maybe giving your child a chance at a better life would be an option????
I would not give it up for adoption I would keep it.  The biggest concern is my health and the babies during and after the pregnancy.

I think you should look at it in a positive way, babies are a blessing and if God feeds the little birds that are out and about and they are just birds. He loves us for we are more important then a bird. He knows our needs and trust him and ask him for a better health and strength for you and baby.  Faith can move mountains . =) God bless you n your Family.

question: Sorry for the long post...I am 39 years old, have a 12 and 15 year old daughters, and health problems.  I have fibromyalgia, which if you know what it is, you know it has a ton of symptoms and I have it pretty severe, also am 65 pounds overweight and have pre-diabetes.  I spend most of my life these days laying down because of the pain and fatigue from the fibro, my daughters already don't get much attention, and we are poor on food stamps and late on all our bills.  I was not planning on having any more children and I'm so scared of all this, I am 2 months along and am soooo miserable, I am so out of breath now that I have to crawl up the stairs to get to the bathroom, and then I have to scoot back down the stairs slowly on my butt.  My doctor said because of all these issues it would be resonable to get an abortion and that she will support me wahtever I decide.  Does anyone have some advice for me?  I keep flip-flopping back and forth on this.  I am so scared I can't make it through this and mainly worried about getting full blown diabetes and the baby would have it to.
title: 39, not healthy, scared and confused
